biotools.summary: XAOM (X-ray Alignment and Orientation Method) is a method for automatic alignment and orientation of radiographs for computer-aided medical diagnosis.  XAOM is a two-stage method for X-ray image alignment and orientation. The first stage of the XAOM is aligning images, while the second stage is orienting them by giving an orientation label (north, south, east, west).
